### Read the data
Address of registered voter in Wake County
```{r}
Wake_county <- read.csv("http://tiny.cc/dcf/street-addresses.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
```

Addresses of medicare service provider.
```{r}
download.file(url = "http://tiny.cc/dcf/CMS_ProvidersSimple.rds", destfile = "MedicareProvider.rds")
Medicare <- readRDS("MedicareProvider.rds")
```

Filter out the addresses using common street words
```{r}
pattern <- "ST|RD|ROAD|AVE|LN|DR|CIR|TRAIL|CT|LANE|COURT|PL|TR|WAY|BLVD|PKWY|BLV|PT|HWY|TRL|TERRACE|RIDGE|PARKWA|ALY|ALLEY|LOOP|PATH"
Left_over <-
  Wake_county %>%
  filter(!grepl(pattern, address), #filter out addresses that have ST, RD, or ROAD
         !grepl("BOX", address)) #filter out addresses with BOX
```

New column of street word
```{r}
pattern <- "(ST|RD|ROAD|AVE|LN|DR|CIR|TRAIL|CT|LANE|COURT|PL|TR|WAY|BLVD|PKWY|BLV|PT|HWY|TRL|TERRACE|RIDGE|PARKWA|ALY|ALLEY|LOOP|PATH)"
Street_word <- Wake_county %>%
  tidyr::extract(address, into = "street_word", regex = pattern, remove = FALSE)
```

Count street word
```{r}
Tally <- 
  Street_word %>%
  group_by(street_word) %>%
  tally()
```
